summary_points: 1. As of June 26, 2025, General Mills' net sales for the first quarter of Fiscal Year 2025 were $4,848.1 million, a decrease compared to $4,904.7 million in the same period of Fiscal Year 2024.
2.  The allowance for doubtful accounts increased from $25.0 million at the beginning of Fiscal Year 2025 to $33.2 million at the end, primarily due to additions charged to expense ($36.6 million).
3. The reserve for LIFO valuation increased by $4.5 million during Fiscal Year 2025, reaching $545.6 million by year-end.
1. As of May 29, 2025,  Micron had $1.02 billion in finance lease obligations for gas supply and equipment leases not yet commenced.

2.  A jury verdict in a patent infringement lawsuit (May 23, 2024) resulted in a $425 million judgment against Micron for infringement of the '912 patent and $20 million for the '417 patent; Micron plans to appeal.
3.  Micron's Board of Directors authorized a share repurchase program with no expiration date for up to $10 billion of outstanding common stock, having repurchased $7.19 billion through May 29, 2025.
Failed to analyze filing

1. Mars' acquisition of Kellanova has received all but one of the required 28 regulatory clearances, with only the European Commission's review outstanding; the companies expect the transaction to close towards the end of 2025.
2. Kellanova's 2023 net sales were $13 billion.

3.  The SEC filing notes several risks associated with the pending merger, including the possibility of non-completion, failure to satisfy closing conditions, and potential negative impacts on Kellanova's stock price, credit ratings, or operations.
1. Equinix projects 7-10% annual revenue growth through 2029, with adjusted EBITDA margins expanding to 52% or greater by 2029.
2.  The company forecasts 5-9% annual AFFO per share growth from 2025 through 2029,  with at least 5% growth anticipated for 2026, accelerating to the high end of the range by 2029.
3. Equinix anticipates 8% or greater annual dividend per share growth from 2025 through 2029.

1. Solventum Corp (formerly 3M Health Care Co) and Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. amended their transaction agreement on June 25, 2025, removing Solventum's drinking water filtration business from the sale and reducing the purchase price from approximately $4.10 billion to $4.00 billion.

2.  The revised agreement increases Solventum's estimated annual earnings per share accretion from 15-20 cents to an unspecified higher amount, but will reduce the previously projected gross and operating margin improvements of 200 and 100 basis points, respectively.
3. Thermo Fisher will receive a payment of up to $75 million from Solventum within 3 years of closing or upon the sale of the retained water filtration business.

1. Nike, Inc. nominated Jørgen Vig Knudstorp for election to its Board of Directors at its 2025 annual shareholder meeting on September 9, 2025.
2.  The SEC filing is a Form 8-K, indicating a current report filed on June 25, 2025, concerning a material event.
3.  No specific future impacts or risks, or regulatory developments are mentioned in this filing excerpt.
